required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of COVID-19 Infection During Pregnancy on Newborns and Young Children
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of SARS-CoV-2 Infection During Pregnancy on Newborns and Young Children

brief_summary.textblock: This study aim is to assess impact of COVID-19 infection during pregnancy on outcome of pregnancy, and on developement of the child in early life.

detailed_description.textblock:
All pregnant women will be tested for serology during each trimester of pregnancy and at delivery, together with a nasal swab. Children born to women with positive sawb or serology will be followed up for 3 years together with a control child born to negative mother.
In positive mothers, maternal antibodies at delivery will be characterized, placental transfer will be assessed. Persistence of antibodies in children at the age of 1 month and presence of antibodies in breast milk will be measured.
Occurence of premature birth, low birth weight, miscarriage, congenital malformations will be compared in positive and negative mothers. Follow up of children over the first 3 years of life will assess difference in susceptibility to infections and neurological developement in both groups.

primary_outcome.description: Incidence of miscarriage, premature delivery, low birth weight, preeclampsia, chorioamnionitis

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of positive serology to SARS-CoV-2 at delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of antibodies in maternal serum at delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Transplacental transfer of antibodies to SARS-CoV-2
secondary_outcome.description: Measure the ratio of cord blood antibodies on maternal antibodies titers

secondary_outcome.measure: To characterize placental alterations related to SARS-CoV-2 infection
secondary_outcome.description: Placental histology will be performed in women tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 during pregnancy

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of maternal antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 in breast milk in breastfeeding mothers
To characterize the immunity transmitted to the newborn to cord blood and its persistence at the age of 1 month of life
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of antibodies in cord blood and at the age of 1 month
Occurence of infectious disease, neurological development, growth

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women tested positive to SARS-CoV-2 during pregnancy
arm_group.description: All women who had a positive nasal swab or a positive serology during pregnancy or at delivery are included. Follow up end at 1 month post delivery.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women tested negative to SARS-CoV-2 during pregnancy
arm_group.description: All women who had a positive nasal swab or a positive serology during pregnancy or at delivery are included. No follow up after delivery.
Newborns born to mothers who had a positive nasal swab or a positive serology during pregnancy or at delivery and who consented the follow up study. Follow up end at 3 years of age.

Newborns born to mothers who had no COVID-19 infection during pregnancy or at delivery and who consented the follow up study. These control children will be matched with children from the other group for gestational age and ethnicity. Follow up end at 3 years of age.

intervention.arm_group_label: Women tested negative to SARS-CoV-2 during pregnancy
Women tested positive to SARS-CoV-2 during pregnancy

biospec_descr.textblock: Maternal specimens (placental tissue, serum, breast milk), Newborn specimens (umbilical cord blood)and infant specimens (serum)

study_pop.textblock: All women who deliver in the CHU St Pierre and children born to positive mothers and controls matched on gestational age and ethnicity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For pregnant women, all women who deliver in the CHU St Pierre, with oral consent.
- For children follow up: children born to positive mothers and matched controls after written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
